destroyed.text: You've demolished the Union vessel, and their scrap is yours.

deadCrew.text: You've erased all life from the Union vessel, and their scrap is yours.

surrender.text: "Stop! Stop! Take a slave and let us go. Kill us, and they all die regardless!"

escape.text: As if they were ready for this, they immediately power on their engines. You'd better be quick, this ship's engines are unusually strong.

surrender.text: "Look, we just want to deliver our package! Take this and leave us alone!"

destroyed.text: The smuggler's ship rips itself apart as the engines go up in flames.

deadCrew.text: With nothing stopping you from exploring the hold, you're able to find something. It's not clear if this was the important delivery they were making, but it's yours for the taking.

event.text: Unfortunately, their supposedly valuable cargo doesn't seem to have survived.
Unfortunately, their supposedly valuable cargo doesn't seem to have survived.
Unfortunately, their supposedly valuable cargo doesn't seem to have survived.
You're able to find something in their cargo that survived.

surrender.text: The pirates hail you. "Ok, you've made your point Mr. Feddy Man. These are your supplies, yes yes, but we need to be able to feed ourselves too! How about we make a compromise?"

choice.text: Agree to their compromise and split the supplies.

event.text: You collect the supplies and leave the pirates alone.

surrender.text: "You winnings! Most greatest of fighters. As promise, I coming with."

destroyed.text: By mistake... or by intent, it appears you have slain the Free Mantis. There's nothing left but to scrap their hull.

deadCrew.text: By mistake... or by intent, it appears you have slain the Free Mantis. There's nothing left but to scrap their hull.

event.text: Once safely returned to the realm of the living, the Free Mantis applauds you. "Excellency of fighter beyond any realm of imaginings! I must coming with and see you in further action."
Once safely returned to the realm of the living, the Free Mantis applauds you. "Excellency of fighter beyond any realm of imaginings! I must coming with and see you in further action."

choice.text: (Upg. Clone Bay) Revive the Free Mantis.

event.text: Once safely returned to the realm of the living, the Free Mantis applauds you. "Excellency of fighter beyond any realm of imaginings! I must coming with and see you in further action."
Once safely returned to the realm of the living, the Free Mantis applauds you. "Excellency of fighter beyond any realm of imaginings! I must coming with and see you in further action."
Once safely returned to the realm of the living, the Free Mantis applauds you. "Excellency of fighter beyond any realm of imaginings! I must coming with and see you in further action."

textList.name: TEXT_FINISH_BEACON_DROPPOINT_ENCOUNTER
textList.text: "Blegh, you're the ship we traveled all the way from Universe 1 to meet? I thought they said you were a THREAT." Looks like you'll have to show these guys not to underestimate you.
"Looks like you've stumbled into my.... AMBUSH! Nyeh heh heh! Heh. Heh... Die." The Rebel ship moves in to attack.
"Your mistake for coming here, bucko. End of the line!" It's the end of the line for someone, but let's hope it's not you!
The Rebel captain says nothing, but imitates a pair of guns with his fingers and draws a line across his throat. When did the Rebels get so childish?
The Rebel captain breaks into laughter upon seeing your ship. You won't take this insult lightly. Not like you have a choice, since their weapons are already firing!

event.name: FINISH_BEACON_DROPPOINT
event.text: You've reached the end of the first step of your journey. However, it appears you aren't alone. The Rebel fleet must have sent one of their fighters after you!

event.name: NEBULA_FINISH_BEACON_DROPPOINT
event.text: You've arrived at the Long-Range Beacon. When the FTL Drive is charged you can jump to the next Sector.

event.name: FINISH_BEACON_DROPPOINT_WIN
event.text: You've successfully defeated the Rebel ship. You now have some time to do something else on the ship.

event.name: FINISH_BEACON_DROPPOINT_WIN_FLEET
event.text: You've successfully defeated the Elite ship, but you don't have any time to do something else because of the fleet.

event.name: MV_STORE_RESCUE
event.text: Once you arrive at this populated region, you immediately pick up a distress signal. A small shuttle is asking anyone who'll listen for help protecting their family from a Rebel ship. Unsurprisingly, no one has yet responded to their request.

choice.text: See if you can assist them.

event.text: It seems that a small space dock has done something to anger the Rebels. The store there is run by his family and he pleads that you rescue them. He uploads the coordinates of the station to your navigation system.
You block the channel and prepare to jump as soon as possible.

destroyed.text: The outpost hails you, "Thank you! I don't know what we did to anger the Rebels, but they were ready to kill us. I'll show you our goods and patch up your hull."

deadCrew.text: The outpost hails you, "Thank you! I don't know what we did to anger the Rebels, but they were ready to kill us. I'll show you our goods and patch up your hull."

event.name: MV_QUEST_STORE_RESCUE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: A Rebel ship is harassing a space dock at these coordinates.

event.text: Once you arrive at the beacon you detect a Rebel scout assaulting a compound on a nearby desolate moon.

choice.text: Engage the Rebel and rescue the space dock.

event.text: You lock onto the Rebel and move in to engage.
After a time the ship powers down its weapons and jumps away. No life-signs are detected on the moon.
"Great. Take this bit of fuel as a down-payment. We'll be one step behind you, following your jump signatures. Don't want to take any risks now, do we?"
"We understand. Not everyone is confident they can survive in these hostile times, let alone take the responsibility of protecting others."
The civilians are shocked by your sudden hostility, but have no chance to escape.

textList.name: QUEST_ESCORT_TEXT
textList.text: After a short time you receive a message, "Hello. I hope it's not a bother, but I'm looking for an escort to a nearby system. This region is quite dangerous and our ship is not well-armed."
There is a single ship at this beacon. They hail you, "We could really use some help. Our FTL navigation system is shot. Can you help us get to a nearby station where they can patch us up?"
"Hello," your communicator opens a hail from a nearby ship. "Our weapon systems are malfunctioning and we're too afraid of pirates to travel home unassisted. Can you escort us?"

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You were asked to escort an unprepared vessel to these coordinates.

event.text: You escort the ship to the requested beacon. Much to your dismay you are ambushed by a Rebel ship. You walked right into their trap!

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You were asked to escort an unprepared vessel to these coordinates.

event.text: Shortly after you arrive, the ship you were escorting jumps nearby. They thank you for your help and offer you a reward.

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You were asked to escort an unprepared vessel to these coordinates.

event.text: The ship you were escorting thanks you, "I don't think we could have made it without your help. Let my friends patch up some of your hull and show you their wares."

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You were asked to escort an unprepared vessel to these coordinates.

event.text: You arrive and the ship you were escorting jumps in behind you. "Thanks for the help. We work at a nearby fusion power plant, we could try to improve your reactor's output as a form of compensation."

textList.name: TRAP_BEACON_TEXT
textList.text: You arrive at the beacon and immediately detect a pirate ship. It seems this distress beacon was a trap!
"Haha! I knew someone would fall into our dastardly trap!" It appears this distress beacon was nothing but a decoy for a pirate ambush.
Your cockpit lights up with warning signals. You are being targeted by a nearby ship. The distress call was a lure to attract unwitting ships into weapons range. You prepare for a fight.
As soon as you arrive at the distress signal, shots are fired toward your ship. A trap!

event.name: MV_DISTRESS_TRAPPED_MINER
event.text: You arrive at the distress beacon near a small asteroid belt and find a ship with pirate markings partially crushed between two large rocks. It must have been illegally mining the belt without proper equipment.

choice.text: Try to dislodge the ship by shooting at the rocks.
Destroy and loot the ship. They're just pirates.
(Beam Weapon) Carefully cut the ship out.

event.text: You use your beam to make a few precision cuts in the asteroid. The ship gives a quick burst of thrust and the rock crumbles away. They thank you and offer some of the resources they have collected.

choice.text: (Damaging Pinpoint Weapon) Attempt to meticulously cut out the pirate ship.

event.text: With what is possibly the dumbest decision you have ever made, you take the increduously long time to chip away at the asteroid with your Pinpoint. You're certain the fleet has caught up by now and you've barely made any impact, giving you no choice but to abandon the pirate ship.

choice.text: (Beam Drone) Have your drone cut the ship out.

event.text: You program the drone to work carefully around the trapped ship. In a short time it allows the ship to easily slip out of its cage. They thank you and offer some of the resources they have collected.

You take a few careful shots but you expose a mineral patch in the rock that reacts violently with your weapon. A shockwave forces you back as debris pelts against your hull. When you regain control you find there is not much left of the ship.
You fire a few volleys into the rock and it starts to shudder and break apart. Without shields the pirate ship takes a beating but eventually pulls free. They thank you for your assistance.
You decide the pirate is not worth saving and fire a few volleys into their hull causing the ship to depressurize and break apart. You move in to loot the remains.

You decide the pirate is not worth saving and fire a few volleys into their hull. Before you can scrap the remains another pirate ship flashes on your radar. Perhaps they saw your deed, or perhaps they want to claim the spoils for themselves, but for whatever reason, they're charging weapons!

event.name: MV_DISTRESS_CRASH_LANDING
event.text: You arrive at a lonely planet orbiting a dying star. A quick scan of the surface reveals a ship crash landed on the far side of the planet. It's in shambles, but there is a chance someone may have survived.
Even if someone did survive, there's not much you could do to help them.

destroyed.text: You've defeated the Rebel ship. You scrap its remains.

event.text: The Rebel carrier was in worse condition than you thought. The rest of its fleet is offline and they are defenseless against you. They give you some supplies as a surrender.

deadCrew.text: You've defeated the Rebel ship. You scrap its remains.

event.text: The Rebel carrier was in worse condition than you thought. The rest of its fleet is offline and they are defenseless against you. They give you some supplies as a surrender.
The ship here is no ordinary vessel. It's a massive Rebel carrier! It must have detected you, because its few remaining systems come online and it dispenses a ship to face you.
The ship that crashed appears to be a Federation Dreadnaught! There may still be crew alive, but the ship seems to be in a critical state.

choice.text: There's no saviors aboard your vessel to send over.
It's too late, we should go.

event.text: The ship appears to have once been a Federation carrier, but it's beyond repair. A good section of the hull has collapsed and it's very doubtful anyone survived.

choice.text: We aren't pirates, it would be disrespectful to scrap the ship.

event.text: Your crew returns with a single survivor. It appears the rest of the Federation crew were either killed in the crash or the following inferno.
You watch in horror as the carrier collapses, no doubt burying your crew inside.

removeCrew.text: Luckily your crew is already being cloned and is revived a short time later.

event.text: You are uninterrupted as you salvage the carrier.
It appears one of the Federation Auto-ships onboard is still functional! It detects your attempts at salvaging as hostile and attacks.

event.name: MV_ASTEROID_EXPLORE
event.text: Scans reveal a large asteroid field nearby. Short-range scanners may discover useful materials while we wait for the FTL to recharge.

choice.text: Too dangerous. We'll just wait for the FTL to charge.

event.text: You decide to not risk exploring the asteroid field.

choice.text: (Scrap Recovery Arm) Attempt to mine the asteroids.

event.text: You carefully extract as much usable material as possible from the nearest asteroids while waiting for the FTL to charge.

choice.text: (Magnetic Arm) Attempt to mine the asteroids.

event.text: Your magnetic arm is not well suited to the task, but it is able to salvage a very small portion of space junk drifting around nearby.

choice.text: (Mining Equipment) Attempt to mine the asteroids.

event.text: You carefully extract as much usable material as possible from the nearest asteroids while waiting for the FTL to charge.

choice.text: (Beam Drone) Attempt to mine the asteroids. [-1|]

event.text: You carefully extract as much usable material as possible from the nearest asteroids while waiting for the FTL to charge.
A brief exploration yields nothing of interest.
Scans reveal a number of asteroids with useful compositions. You extract some fuel.
You discover the remains of ship embedded into an asteroid. It still has some functional missiles.
You happen upon an abandoned mining site. A few mining drones were left behind and could be repurposed.
The asteroid field proved more dangerous than expected. Some asteroids managed to get through your ship's defenses.
A pirate ship hiding behind one of the larger asteroids attacks you! You're able to escape from the asteroid field, but you can't lose the pirates.

event.name: MV_TAVERN_HIRE
event.text: It appears several mercenaries are competing for attention at a small inn, hoping to find work aboard a Multiverse vessel.
You ignore the crew.

event.name: MV_HELP_MINERS
event.text: You come across a mining operation around this beacon. "Hail, captain! We've been dispatched to harvest the ores from these asteroids to be used in development of a new experimental fuel source for Multiverse drives. However, we've run short on ammunition... perhaps you could lend us some?"

choice.text: (Explosive Replicator) Use the replicator to synthesize the missiles for them.
(Missile Weapon) Offer to blast through the mine with your Launcher.

event.text: "I don't think you quite understand. I understand your... enthusiasm... but it's not exactly 'union friendly' to use military ballistic weapons in mining operations. Perhaps it's best we don't make any trades..."

choice.text: (Bomb Weapon) Offer to solve their problem by using a controlled explosion from your bomb. [-1}]

event.text: "Curious. I did not consider the practicality of using a bomb for such matters. I suppose it should be safe enough. You have my permission."

choice.text: (Lost Sun Crew) Offer to teach them how to construct makeshift explosives.

event.text: Your commando, being both an experienced arsonist and knowledgeable in the ways of explosives, explains to the miners how the Lost Suns have been using "recycled" ammunition to save costs. Thoroughly impressed by this knowledge, the colony's leader grants you access to some of their latest spoils.
"I understand. Good luck out there. We'll try to make do with what we have."

event.name: MV_TERRAFORMING_SCAN
event.text: A small terraforming team working on a nearby moon hails you, and a short, stubby Rockman captain appears on the screen. "We require assistance, and you are the first ship we've seen in this system for weeks. We're in the middle of terraforming this barren moon, but our sensors aren't strong enough to break through the atmosphere."

"Thank you! We need to scan this planet for life before we can begin terraforming, but our sensors can't get the necessary power to scan through this atmosphere. We've got a schedule to keep, any chance you can help?"

choice.text: (Upg. Sensors) Set sensors to maximum and scan.
(Bonus Power Crew) Send your crewman to overcharge their systems.
(Osmian Crew) Generate a hologram to overcharge their systems.
(Shell Scientist) Have your Shell assist them.

event.text: "We understand. Best of luck on your mission, sir!"
It seems your sensors are no more powerful than the terraformer's. You apologize and continue on your way.
You find if you modulate the feedback signal of your sensors to just the right frequency, you're able to get through the atmosphere and perform a complete scan!

After a complete scan of the planet, you find no life. The team is grateful and ready to get to work. The station scientists have a unique talent for life support units and offer to upgrade your oxygen system as thanks.

A complete scan of the planet reveals no life signs other than a single ship on the surface. The terraformers thank you for your help, and attempt to contact the ship. Just as you're about to jump away, the ship takes off and attacks, it's a pirate!
A complete scan of the planet reveals a simple mold as the only life present. The terraformers claim their terraforming plans are only hindered by intelligent life; they can begin their work.

choice.text: Tell them to stop. Any life is valuable.

event.text: "But our livelihood depends on this job! Who cares about some silly mold? We'll pay you to look the other way!"

choice.text: Offer to pay them to at least delay until the mold can be studied.

event.text: They see reason and accept the offer. The station scientists have a unique talent for life support units and offer to upgrade your oxygen system as an apology for their behaviour.

choice.text: Power your weapons and demand they leave at once.

event.text: They shut off communications, but you can tell they have begun an evacuation procedure.

choice.text: Go looking for the Rebel ship.
No time to search, you prepare to jump away.

event.text: You decide not to go hunting for Rebels.

choice.text: (Upg. Sensors) Perform a scan of the area.

event.text: You quickly find the Rebel ship's location and move to intercept.
You find the Rebel ship hiding on a nearby asteroid. You are able to get a shot off and permanently disable their engines before they notice you.
You spend some time looking around but your scanners cannot pick up any trace of the Rebel ship.
After far too much time spent searching, you are finally able to track him down. You go into the fight pondering just how much of a head start you've lost on the Rebel Fleet...
After a short search you find the Rebel ship. Let's hope he's as easy to defeat in combat as he was to find.
You are able to quickly track down the Rebel. Let's hope he's as easy to defeat in combat as he was to find.

event.name: MV_REFUGEE_NO_DISTRESS
event.text: Your sensors have picked up a refugee ship drifting through the system, no doubt one of many fleeing the Rebel advance. It doesn't appear to have detected you... or else it is trying to avoid notice.
You decide to ignore the refugees.
As you hail the freighter, it advances, weapons bristling from its hull! It's a pirate ambush!
As you hail the refugee ship, a Rebel ship jumps into the system... they must have been hunting these refugees, but since you're a Federation ship you've taken higher priority on their list.
As you hail the refugee ship, a Rebel ship jumps into the system... they must have been hunting these refugees, but since you're a Federation ship you've taken higher priority on their list.
As you hail the refugee ship, a Mantis ship jumps into the system... they must have been hunting these civilians but now that they've found you they've changed targets!

event.name: DROPPOINT_SKETCHY_UPGRADES
event.text: You're surprised to find another Multiverse ship at this beacon, bearing markings of a pirate vessel.

The pirates hail you. "Ah, a fellow traveller! I'm sure we can both relate over the difficulty of upkeep with these MV drives, yes? Well, we've been running low on fuel and I'm sure you could use an upgrade, maybe we can trade?"
Surprisingly, the pirates do honor their deal, and your engines have gained in efficiency. This will be a welcome boost for the road ahead.

"Wait wait wait, before you do that. Look, do the math, right? It's only a handful of fuel, 3 scrap each, right? What I am offering is an upgrade for basically 9 scrap. Think about it! It's a great offer!"
Surprisingly, the pirates do honor their deal, and your engines have gained in efficiency. This will be a welcome boost for the road ahead.
"Wow, you must really be bad at math, or desperate for fuel. Your stupidity bodes well for me!"
"Your loss."

event.name: DROPPOINT_SLAVER
event.text: A slaver ship approaches, one of the Tiiikaka clan's distributers. In a bold display of characteristic pirate arrogance, the ship opens comms with you and offers several slaves.

choice.text: We can't let pirates waltz in Federation space. Take these guys down!

event.text: These pirates have gotten out of hand. Best you clean this reality up of their kind.
The pirate scoffs and cuts comms.

The slaver gives you a tour of the cramped dungeon that he considers fit for keeping living things. It's deplorable, but with some scrap, you can free one of these slaves to work for you instead. It's probably a better fate.
You acquire the slave and swifly leave before the slaver decides to pull any form of foul play.
You acquire the slave and swifly leave before the slaver decides to pull any form of foul play.

The slaver gives you a tour of the cramped dungeon that he considers fit for keeping living things. It's deplorable, but with some scrap, you can free one of these slaves to work for you instead. It's probably a better fate.
You acquire the slave and swifly leave before the slaver decides to pull any form of foul play.
You acquire the slave and swifly leave before the slaver decides to pull any form of foul play.

event.name: DROPPOINT_CACHE
event.text: An abandoned supply cache drifts through space nearby. It must have been lost during an attack. You aren't sure who it belongs to - but you could use it for a trap against the fleet, or try your luck with opening it.
As a wise man once said - when you can't be certain, just apply a very large amount of militry grade explosives and pray to the high heavens you don't go up in flames.

choice.text: Set a trap for the fleet.

event.text: This'll throw them off for a bit. Let's just hope no civilians or Feds get greedy and try to open it first.
You pull away from the cache and leave.

Once you get the cache open, you realize the entire thing is filled with explosives! It's for supplies, of course, but if you had tried to blow it open that would have gone very poorly. You take everything inside.
The cache looks to be filled with batteries and other various reactor parts. You could use these to improve the efficiency of your own reactor!
Looks like the cache is protected by some kind of complicated keypad connected to a bomb. Playing with it is too risky. You leave the cache behind, disappointed.
You open up the cache, only to find a band of malnourished and ravenous pirates trapped inside!
Your missiles detonate... only for the entire cache to explode a split second later! The force is so great it even damages your hull. That cache must have been filled with explosives!
The cache looks to be filled with batteries and other various reactor parts. You could use these to improve the efficiency of your own reactor!

The doors of the cache explode, revealing a band of ravenous pirates locked inside. Now exposed to the vacuum of space, they quickly perish. You shuffle past their lifeless bodies and find an armament inside the cache.

event.name: DROPPOINT_ORCHIDS
event.text: To your surprise, an Orchid ship is waiting for you here. Sure, they're a loyal part of the Federation, but the Florals typically prefer to keep to their own turf. What's this about?

An Orchid appears on screen, gesturing with their hands in native Orchid sign language, which your translator converts into actual audio. "Hello! You must be professor Orwell. We have reviewed the files you gave us and we are most excited to share our scientific findings with the board. We have left a few annotated questions for your review, and will send them over along with payment shortly!"

choice.text: Yes, that's me. I'm Orwell. Definitely.

event.text: "Wonderful!" The Orchids send over a series of annotated videos of what appears to be human adult films with extremely questionable titles, and some scrap.
"Oh. I am terribly sorry. Would you happen to know the location of the professor?"
The Orchid stares blanky at you. "I'm afraid I don't understand. Are you, as the humans call it, 'pulling my leg'? It would be appreciated if you did not mess with foreigners." The Orchids hang up.
"Understandable. I appreciate your straightforwardness. Good day!" The Orchid ship jumps away, but not before leaving you with a few fuel cells as a customary gift.
You're barely out the gate of your mission and you're already murdering random innocents. This really does not speak well to your motives.

choice.text: Ignore the Orchids and fly away.

event.text: You simply fly past the ship, and they make no attempt to follow you. Odd, but nothing for you to worry about now.

event.name: DROPPOINT_PIRATE_RAID
event.text: It appears this beacon is home to a Federation outpost... or at least it was, until a band of pirates came by and ravaged the place! There might be some supplies left behind if you can clear out the attackers.
Those supplies belong to the Federation, not these damn pirates! You prepare for combat.

choice.text: Ignore them, it's not worth the effort.

event.text: The pirates can help themselves to those supplies, they'll need everything they can get until the Rebel fleet catches up and destroys them.

event.name: DROPPOINT_PIRATE_RAID_WIN
event.text: You've defeated the pirates. Not eager to mess with you further, the rest of their clan scatter.
You skirt around the edge of the depot, looking for any remaining loot. Though the pirates took all of the weapons and armor, quite a few resources remain.

event.name: DROPPOINT_FORTIFICATIONS
event.text: Nearby are some Federation fortifications that have taken heavy damage. A couple workers are busy trying to patch up the damage.

choice.text: Hail and ask if they need any assistance.

event.text: "Any help you could offer would be a life saver. We only just barely managed to chase away those damn Rebels, and they'll no doubt be returning with reinforcements soon. We're undermanned and we won't be able to get these repairs done in time."

choice.text: Offer to wait behind longer and fight off the Rebels.

event.text: You wait behind until you spot a small squadron of Rebel ships approaching. Hurry to combat positions!

choice.text: Lend a crew member to stay and assist them.

event.text: Though it's only one man, the Federation officers seem to understand the weight of your decision and pay you greatly for your sacrifice.

removeCrew.text: Your crew cannot be cloned as they are not dead.

choice.text: You cannot lend any crew, as you don't have any to begin with.

event.text: You apologize and end comms.
The staff will hopefully be able to repair their defenses in time before the fleet arrives.

event.name: DROPPOINT_FORTIFICATIONS_GOTAWAY
event.text: The Rebel ships jump away once again, leaving you and the fortifications behind.

"Thank you for your help, but I am afraid this is very unfortunate that they got away. We know you can't wait behind any longer, and I don't think anyone else will arrive in time to assist us. Still, at least it buys us some time. We can't offer too much, but perhaps this fuel will help."

event.name: DROPPOINT_FORTIFICATIONS_WIN
event.text: It appears the rest of the Rebel squadron is trying to flee after watching their comrades be destroyed by you. The Federation officers thank you and offer payment.

event.name: DROPPOINT_PROTESTORS
event.text: Several Union civillian vessels have landed on a nearby moon around a Federation Multiverse warp-bay. You can see crowds gathering but you aren't sure why.

The civilians appear to be protesting, gathering in large groups and holding up signs. It appears the crowd is against the use of Multiverse travel, thinking it endangers their ways of life. The Federation soldiers hold their ground and try to fend off the civilians, but it appears the situation is getting heated.

choice.text: Attack one of the Union vessels.

event.text: You open fire on one of the Union vessels nearby.

choice.text: Send in a team of crew to assist.
The giant killing machine you are flying is not currently equipped to handle rioters with a non-lethal approach.

event.text: You pull away from the moon before you're spotted.
You have no interest in whatever is happening on the moon.

The rest of the civilians, having seen your brutal attack, flee in fear. This won't help improve the public view of Multiverse Renegades, but at least the Federation soldiers were saved. They reluctantly offer you some resources.

It appears your attack drove many of the Civilians to violence, and full-scale fighting has broken out in the streets. One civilian ship with a particularly nasty looking missile launcher tears through your hull, and you pull away quickly.

The civilians are forced to flee as the Federation soldiers take this opportunity to retake the block and drive back the protesters. The whole situation goes over with few casualties, save for the civilians you just murdered. The Federation staff is thankful for your assistance, though disapproving of your methods, and offer some supplies.

You land the vessel right in the middle of the conflict, careful not to squish anyone. Your crew exit and talk over the situation with the protesters. They manage to convince them not to resort to violence, and the crowds slowly dwindle away. The Federation staff seem pleased you were able to resolve the situation peacefully, and provide you a reward for your assistance.

The situation is too chaotic for you to land the ship nearby, so you pilot a short distance away from the main scene of conflict and drop off your crew. They're dragged into what has now descended into full on gun fire, and one of your crew is tagged straight in the chest with blaster fire! You give orders for the rest of the team to head back to the ship immediately.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately your Clone Bay is able to revive your crew member, but you aren't willing to risk sending them back in.

event.text: By the time your crew arrive the situation has already escalated. They manage to rescue one of the Federation staff, a medical unit who was caught in the cross-fire, and bring them back to the ship. Unfortunately, it seems a few of the protesters noticed and have followed you back to the ship!

event.name: DROPPOINT_CRAZYZOLTAN
event.text: A blip on the communicator shows an incoming transmission from a Zoltan ship out of your field of view. When you pick up, you're greeted by the unwelcome sounds of a raving madman screeching about 'cowering beneath the prophet eye'. He demands a prayer and offering, or else suffer his wrath.

choice.text: (Monk Crew) Retaliate with even greater spiritual nonsense.

event.text: Both Zoltans launch into a long debate that gets so heated it eventually reaches a point not even your translator can comprehend the words they are saying. That's mostly because they aren't words, just primal screeching. Your monk returns and reports that the second Zoltan died during the argument, and implores you to not ask questions. You scrap his ship.

Your crew determines he has some kind of mind erosion, not uncommon for elderly Zoltan as their hard-light forms start to deteriorate. They manage to talk some sense into the Zoltan, and convince him to stand down while they take a look at his situation. They manage to patch him up, and in return he joins your crew.

Your drone determines he has some kind of mind erosion, not uncommon for elderly Zoltan as their hard-light forms start to deteriorate. They manage to talk some sense into the Zoltan, and convince him to stand down while they take a look at his situation. They manage to patch him up, and in return he joins your crew.
You've barely started your journey, and you don't intend to dedicate time to listen to the ramblings of a grumpy Zoltan elder.
The Zoltan shouts an insult or two at you, but eventually his ramblings go quiet and the ship jumps away. As far as you can tell, nothing bad has happened from this, and likely never will.

"Then let the curse befall you!" The Zoltan ship jumps away, and is immediately followed by a Rebel ship jumping in! Were the Zoltans working with the Rebels, or is this a pure coincidence? Hard to say, but one thing's for certain. It's time to fight!

"Then let the curse befall you!" The Zoltan ship jumps away, and is immediately followed by a Rebel ship jumping in! Were the Zoltans working with the Rebels, or is this a pure coincidence? Hard to say, but one thing's for certain. It's time to fight!
The Zoltan yells some more obscene nonsense, scoops up the scrap, and jumps away.
The Zoltan scoops up the scrap, and says something prophetic about your good fortune. He jumps away shortly after.

event.name: DROPPOINT_FREEMANTIS
event.text: A Free Mantis greets you eagerly, their broken dialogue challenging the translator to keep up. "Oh Federation captain, I asking of you if you are worthy of my support! Yes, I having faith, but I must seeing proof. Fighting me, winning and I joining of crew. Just knowing be careful, I not taking mercies on you!"
"Then battle shall commencing!" You'll have to rough their hull up a bit to win. If you kill them all, there won't be anyone left to join your crew.
"You are most of borings." The Free Mantis don't seem all that offended despite their message, and wave goodbye as you pass.

event.name: DROPPOINT_BULKY_SMUGGLER
event.text: It's rare to see an Argeonn vessel with no weapons system, and this one is trying to stay away. "I didn't get into this business looking for a fight. If you'll excuse me, I have places to be."

choice.text: Attack the vessel to reclaim its possessions.

event.text: They may not be looking for a fight, but smugglers are not welcome in Federation space.

choice.text: Ask them if they need any help.

event.text: "Funny you should ask. There's a checkpoint at this beacon. If you could keep their eyes off of us, we'd be very grateful."

choice.text: (Elite Federation Crew) Clear the smuggler for passage.

event.text: Your crew explains to the checkpoint that your ship is escorting the smuggler vessel on its way to be decommissioned. Without a second thought, the checkpoint waves you past. "Connections really are a smuggler's best friend, huh? Thanks for the assist."

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the checkpoint to let them through.

event.text: Your crew explains to the checkpoint that your ship is escorting the smuggler vessel on its way to be decommissioned. As you finish explaining, you toggle on your mind control systems to wipe away whatever skepticism they might have had. The smuggler wastes no time getting through the checkpoint.
The hack goes off without a hitch. As the checkpoint guards wave you in, the smuggler passes through with you, undetected. "Thanks for the assist, that was going to be a real headache."

choice.text: Distract the checkpoint with idle chatter.

event.text: You drag the checkpoint into a long winded conversation. It's hard to keep their attention, as the smuggler seems to be taking their sweet time circumventing the security. By the time you're done with your distraction, it seems like they've caught on to what you're doing. You get the impression it's not wise for you to stick around much longer.
You're able to catch the Smuggler on the other end of the checkpoint, just out of range of the station. "Not exactly an artful solution, but a deal is a deal."

choice.text: Report the smuggler to the checkpoint.

event.text: After you identify the smuggler ship's location, it is surrounded by Federation ships, their crew escorted away. The checkpoint guard offers you some supplies for helping them locate the smuggler.

choice.text: Apologize and say there's nothing you can do.

event.text: You give the smuggler some space. It's not worth the trouble to get involved.
The hack goes off without a hitch. As the checkpoint guards wave you in, the smuggler passes through with you, undetected. "Thanks for the assist, that was going to be a real headache."

Seems like the hack triggered an alarm. Your ship and the smuggler are confronted at the checkpoint. The smuggler manages to escape without paying you, and you get a stern lecture by the checkpoint crew.

event.name: DISTRESS_DROPPOINT_ZOLTAN
event.text: A Zoltan ship hails you as you arrive. "You have to help us! Our energy shield hasn't been working properly ever since we came to this sector. It's acting like it doesn't have the power to start even though it does."

choice.text: (Energy Shield) Use your own shield to jumpstart theirs.

event.text: Their shield projector hums back to life. "All systems are nominal... Great! It should come back on once we jump. Thanks for the help."

choice.text: (Emergency Generator) Use the Emergency Generator to jumpstart it.

event.text: Their shield projector hums back to life. "All systems are nominal... Great! It should come back on once we jump. Thanks for the help."

choice.text: (Backup Battery) Use your battery subsystem to jumpstart it.

event.text: Their shield projector hums back to life. "All systems are nominal... Great! It should come back on once we jump. Thanks for the help."

choice.text: (Leech Crew) Your Leech will check what's wrong with the generator.

event.text: Your Leech seems doubtful that the generator is actually carrying current. Experimentally, your Leech begins to nibble on it. You hear a horrid electrical sound as they yelp out a warbling scream of pain. Moments later your Leech stumbles back onto your ship looking... different. The Zoltans don't seem impressed with your attempt to help.

choice.text: Spend some time trying to fix it.

event.text: You need all the scrap you can get, and this ship will be an easy target.

choice.text: Apologize and say you can't help.

event.text: The Zoltan sigh. "Send someone our way if you can."

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty shield generator. Eventually, they're able to get to the root of the problem, much to the Zoltan's delight. "All systems are nominal... Great! It should come back on once we jump. Thanks for the help."

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty shield generator. While they don't get it working, they manage to diagnose it. "Well, I guess it's better than nothing... Now we know what's wrong." They give you a small reward.

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty shield generator. It momentarily comes to life, then pops. Seems like they only got it partially working. "Well, I guess it's better than nothing... Maybe we can make do with this for now." They give you a modest reward.

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty shield generator. As one of your crew adjusts something, the generator pops and burns before catching fire. Seems like you completely broke it. "Way to go, jackass. Now we're completely screwed."

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty shield generator. Try as they might, they have absolutely no idea what's wrong with it. The Zoltans shake their heads. "How did you think you would know what was wrong if we couldn't figure it out...?"

Your drone begins to tinker with the broken shield generator. Before too long, the drone identifies the problem and the generator comes to life. "All systems are nominal... Great! It should come back on once we jump. Thanks for the help."

Your drone begins to tinker with the broken shield generator. It returns a report saying that there is insufficient resources to repair, but prints a readout of how it could be repaired. "Well, I guess it's better than nothing... Now we know what's wrong." They give you a small reward.

Your drone begins to tinker with the broken shield generator. It momentarily comes to life, then pops. The drone prints a readout of the problems that it identified but couldn't fix. "Well, I guess it's better than nothing... Maybe we can make do with this for now." They give you a modest reward.

event.name: DISTRESS_DROPPOINT_HAZARDOUS_FACILITY
event.text: A station at this beacon has alarms going off, and a distress call is out to save the civilians on board. However, when you arrive, there's already a Federation ship at the location, which hails you. "No worries, we have the situation under control. There was a hazardous chemical leak that proliferated into the station's life support. We have already evacuated this station; it looks like everyone's okay, but we have a civilian on-board who wishes to make a request."

The civilian gets onto the comm. "Ah, hello. I'm a merchant who trades with this station. My ship is fortunately unharmed, but still docked - unfortunately, the toxins have contaminated everything, so I can't undock it myself. If you could steer my ship away and vent the atmosphere, it would likely be safe for me to use it again. It's not quite as contaminated as the station, but you probably won't survive if you aren't careful."

Your anaerobe happens to be able to resist the toxins - they quickly disengage the docking clamps from the vessel and pilot it away. Your crew then proceeds to flush all contaminants from the ship and reactivate life support to refill it with fresh oxygen.

choice.text: Return the ship to its owner.

event.text: Your Shell happens to be able to resist the toxins - they quickly disengage the docking clamps from the vessel and pilot it away. Your crew then proceeds to flush all contaminants from the ship and reactivate life support to refill it with fresh oxygen.

choice.text: Return the ship to its owner.
(Respirators) Have a crewmember enter the ship.

event.text: Your crew pulls on a mask and enters the vessel, then detaches it from the station as fast as they can. They proceed to flush all the toxins from the ship and then reactivate life support to refill it with fresh oxygen.

choice.text: Return the ship to its owner.
(System Drone) Send a system-manning drone onto the ship.

event.text: Your system drone is more than capable of executing the commands you've programmed into it. It pilots the ship away from the station, flushes all toxins from the atmosphere, and then replenishes the oxygen using the life-support system.

choice.text: Return the ship to its owner.

event.text: The merchant gives a frustrated sigh as the Federation officer comes back onto the line. "We'll drop all the civilians off at the nearest settlement until the toxins clear away. Good luck on your mission!"
As monstrous as it is, you turn off the communications console and attack the Federation ship that had just saved the evacuees.

event.name: DROPPOINT_SHIP_TOXIN_FLUSHED
event.text: "Thank goodness. I need my ship for my livelihood. Who knows how long I would have been without it. Here's a small token of my appreciation." The merchant gifts you an augment.

event.name: QUEST_DROPPOINT_POD
event.text: A small escape pod is adrift at this location. Judging from the markings, this pod originated from some multiversal equivalent of Earth: someone likely had to abandon their universe and wound up at the drop point. There's no sign of a ship that this pod may have ejected from. However, before you can pick it up, a Rebel intercepts. "This human will no doubt make a fine recruit for the Rebel cause!"

event.name: DROPPOINT_ACQUIRE_ESCAPE_POD
event.text: The pod is still adrift. It's unlikely to be a trap, but sometimes it's better to be safe than sorry.

The resident of the pod is surprised, as they didn't expect to end up in this universe. You explain your mission, but the human inside seems hesitant to get involved in this conflict without learning more. They request to be dropped off at a nearby colony.
There's no telling who could be in the pod, so you leave it to drift.

event.name: DROPPOINT_ESCAPE_POD_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Drop off the pod survivor at this colony to introduce them to this universe.

event.text: The human thanks you for delivering them to a colony. "This timeline seems more stable than the one I came from, at least. I might join your cause, but give me some time to think about it. In the meantime, I have a reactor core that I hope you will find useful."

textList.name: TEXT_DROPPOINT_SUPPLY_DEPOT
textList.text: You have arrived at a Federation supply depot for Multiverse Renegades. These were established across various realities deemed prominent for protection.
This beacon serves as a temporary outpost for Multiverse-drive equipped vessels, established and maintained by the Federation.
You're not surprised to see this beacon has been outfitted with a Multiverse supply depot. Many such beacons were constructed by prior Multiverse Renegades to help prepare ships such as yours.

event.name: DROPPOINT_SUPPLY_DEPOT_NORMAL
event.text: A brief scan of your ID is all it takes until a Federation Auto-ship is dispatched to transfer over some supplies.

event.name: DROPPOINT_SUPPLY_DEPOT_DESTROYED
event.text: It appears you've arrived a little too late. Something, whether they be pirate or Rebel, has razed this place and destroyed everything in sight. You grab what little salvage remains and carry on.

event.name: DROPPOINT_SUPPLY_DEPOT_REPAIR
event.text: You scan your ID, but no supplies are dispensed. A Federation officer apologizes, explaining their delivery drones were damaged or destroyed by pirates. To compensate, they send one of their repair drones instead, followed by a small team of crew carrying some additional scrap.

event.name: DROPPOINT_SUPPLY_DEPOT_SHORTAGE_FUEL
event.text: The Federation officer who greets you apologizes and explains they're short on supplies. The best they can offer is a small helping of fuel and scrap.

event.name: DROPPOINT_SUPPLY_DEPOT_SHORTAGE_MISSILES
event.text: The Federation officer who greets you apologizes and explains they're short on supplies. The best they can offer is a small helping of ammunition and scrap.

event.name: DROPPOINT_SUPPLY_DEPOT_SHORTAGE_DRONES
event.text: The Federation officer who greets you apologizes and explains they're short on supplies. The best they can offer is a small helping of drone parts and scrap.

event.name: DROPPOINT_SUPPLY_DEPOT_ATTACK_REBEL
event.text: Little remains of the supply depot other than a small helping of scrap. From the rubble descends a Rebel vessel, but they don't seem interested in fighting.
You prepare for battle.
You pull away from the supply depot.

event.name: DROPPOINT_SUPPLY_DEPOT_ATTACK_PIRATE
event.text: Little remains of the supply depot other than a small helping of scrap. A pirate ship jumps in nearby, disappointed to find the supply depot already destroyed.
You prepare for battle.
You pull away from the supply depot.

event.name: DROPPOINT_SUPPLY_DEPOT_ATTACK_MANTIS
event.text: Little remains of the supply depot other than a small helping of scrap. A Mantis hunter approaches menacingly, their weapons humming with power, but not firing yet.
You prepare for battle.
You pull away from the supply depot.
